Generator.name: Xper3
Generator.notes: This software is developed by LIS - Laboratory of Informatics and Systematics (Université Pierre et Marie Curie, UMR 7205, France) - www.infosyslab.fr

Representation.Label: Genetta thierryi
Representation.Detail:
Genetta thierryi Matschie, 1902

Common name: Hausa genet.
Synonyms: rubiginosa Pucheran, 1855; villiersi Dekeyser, 1949.
Distribution: Benin, Burkina Faso, Cameroon, Gambia, Ghana, Guinea Bissau, Ivory Coast, Mali, Nigeria, Niger, Sierra Leone, Senegal, Togo.
Habitat: brush-grass savannah, Guinean savannah, moist woodlands.
Sympatric species: G. genetta, G. maculata, G. pardina .

Representation.Label: Genetta abyssinica
Representation.Detail:
Genetta abyssinica (Rüppel, 1836)

Common name: Abyssinian genet.
Synonyms: none.
Distribution: Djibouti (A. Laurent, Toulouse, pers. comm. 2001), Erytrea, Ethiopia, Somalia, Sudan.
Habitat: from high Ethiopian plateaux (montane moorland and grassland) to steppe and sub-desert areas in plains.
Sympatric species: G. genetta, G. maculata.

Representation.Label: Genetta johnstoni
Representation.Detail:
Genetta johnstoni Pocock, 1908

Common name: Johnston's genet.
Synonyms: lehmanni Kuhn, 1960.
Distribution: Ghana, Guinea, Ivory Coast, Liberia.
Habitat: moist, mixed woodlands and savannah, rain forest.
Sympatric species: G. bourloni, G. pardina, G. poensis, P. leightoni.

Representation.Label: Genetta felina
Representation.Detail:
Genetta felina (Thunberg, 1811)

Common name: South African small-spotted genet.
Synonyms: macrura Jentink, 1892.
Distribution: Angola, Namibia, Orange Free State, South Africa, Zambia.
Habitat: woodland savannah, grassland, thickets, dry vlei areas, bordering of deserts.
Sympatric species: G. genetta, G. "letabae", G. maculata, G. tigrina.

Representation.Label: Poiana richardsonii
Representation.Detail:
Poiana richardsonii (Thomson, 1845)

Common name: Central African oyan.
Synonyms: ochracea Thomas& Wroughton, 1907.
Distribution: Cameroon, Central African Republic, Congo, Democratic Republic of Congo, Equatorial Guinea (including Bioko Isl.), Gabon.
Habitat: rain forest.
Sympatric species: G. cristata, G. maculata, G. piscivora, G. poensis, G. servalina, G. "schoutedeni", G. victoriae.

Representation.Label: Poiana leightoni
Representation.Detail:
Poiana leightoni Pocock, 1908

Common name: West African oyan.
Synonyms: liberiensis Pocock, 1908.
Distribution: Ivory Coast, Liberia.
Habitat: rain forest.
Sympatric species: G. bourloni, G. johnstoni, G. pardina, G. poensis.

Representation.Label: Genetta piscivora
Representation.Detail:
Genetta piscivora (Allen, 1919)

Common name: aquatic genet.
Synonyms: none.
Distribution: Democratic Republic of Congo.
Habitat: rain forest.
Sympatric species: G. maculata, G. "schoutedeni", G. servalina, G. victoriae, P. richardsonii.

Representation.Label: Genetta servalina
Representation.Detail:
Genetta servalina Pucheran, 1855

Common name: servaline genet.
Synonyms: aubryana Pucheran, 1855; archeri Van Rompaey and Colyn, 1998; bettoni Thomas, 1902; intensa Lönnberg, 1917; lowei Kingdon, 1977; schwarzi Crawford-Cabral, 1970.
Distribution: Cameroon, Central African Republic, Congo, Democratic Republic of Congo, Equatorial Guinea, Gabon, Kenya, Tanzania, Uganda.
Habitat: rain forest, woodland savannah, savannah-forest mosaic, montane forest.
Sympatric species: G. maculata, G. piscivora, G. poensis, G. "schoutedeni", G. victoriae, P. richardsonii (G. cristata: uncertain).

Representation.Label: Genetta angolensis
Representation.Detail:
Genetta angolensis Bocage, 1882

Common name: miombo genet.
Synonyms: hintoni Schwarz, 1929; type specimen of mossambica Matschie, 1902, possibly a hybrid between G. maculata and G. angolensis.
Distribution: Angola, Botswana, Democratic Republic of Congo, Malawi, Mozambique, Tanzania, Zambia, Zimbabwe.
Habitat: open miombo (Brachystegia) woodlands interspersed with savannah, savannah-forest mosaic.
Sympatric species: G. genetta, G. "letabae", G. maculata, G. "schoutedeni".

Representation.Label: Genetta cristata
Representation.Detail:
Genetta cristata (Hayman, 1940)

Common name: crested servaline genet.
Synonyms: bini Rosevear, 1974.
Distribution: Cameroon, Nigeria; Gabon and Congo as potential zones of sympatry/intergradation with G. servalina.
Habitat: rain forest.
Sympatric species: G. maculata, G. "schoutedeni", P. richardsonii (G. servalina: uncertain).

Representation.Label: Genetta genetta
Representation.Detail:
Genetta genetta (Linnaeus, 1758)

Common name: common small-spotted genet
Synonyms: afra G. Cuvier, 1825; albipes Trouessart, 1904; balearica Thomas, 1902; barbar Wagner, 184; barbara C. E. H. Smith, 1842; bella Matschie, 1902; bonapartei Loche, 1857; communis Burnett, 1830; dongolana Hemprich and Ehrenberg, 1832; gallica Oken, 1816; grantii Thomas, 1902; guardafuensis Neumann, 1902; hararensis Neumann, 1902; hispanica Oken, 1816; isabelae Delibes, 1977; leptura Reichenbach, 1836; ludia Thomas and Schwann, 1906; lusitanica Seabra, 1924; melas Graells, 1897; neumanni Matschie, 1902; peninsulae Cabrera, 1905; pulchra Matschie, 1902; pyrenaica Bourdelle and Dezillière, 1951; rhodanica Matschie, 1902; senegalensis J. B. Fischer, 1829; tedescoi de Beaux, 1924; terraesanctae Neumann, 1902; vulgaris Lesson, 1827.
Distribution: Algeria, Angola, Benin, Botswana, Burkina Faso, Chad, Djibouti, Egypt, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Ghana, Ivory Coast, Kenya, Mali, Mauritania, Morocco, Mozambique, Namibia, Niger, Nigeria, Oman, Republic of Yemen, Saudi Arabia, Senegal, Somalia, South Africa, Sudan, Tanzania, Togo, Tunisia, Uganda, Zambia, Zimbabwe. Populations in France, Portugal and Spain resulting from introductions during historical times. Individuals episodically found in Belgium, Germany, Holland, Italy and Libya.
Habitat: all habitats except densely forested areas (in Africa).
Sympatric species: G. abyssinica, G. angolensis, G. felina, G. "letabae", G. maculata, G. pardina, G. "schoutedeni", G. thierryi.

Representation.Label: Genetta victoriae
Representation.Detail:
Genetta victoriae Thomas, 1901

Common name: giant genet.
Synonyms: none.
Distribution: Democratic Republic of Congo, Uganda.
Habitat: savannah-forest mosaic, rain forest.
Sympatric species: G. maculata, G. piscivora, G. "schoutedeni", G. servalina, P. richardsonii.

Representation.Label: Genetta pardina
Representation.Detail:
Genetta pardina I. Geoffroy Saint-Hilaire, 1832

Common name: pardine genet.
Synonyms: amer Gray, 1843; dubia Matschie, 1902; pantherina Hamilton-Smith, 1842. The series of specimens representing genettoides Temminck, 1853, are possibly hybrids between G. pardina and G. maculata .
Distribution: Gambia, Ghana, Guinea, Guinea Bissau, Ivory Coast, Liberia, Senegal, Sierra Leone.
Habitat: rain forest, woodland savannah, savannah-forest mosaic, dry savannah.
Sympatric species: G. bourloni, G. genetta, G. johnstoni, G. poensis, G. thierryi, P. leightoni.

Representation.Label: Genetta bourloni
Representation.Detail:
Genetta bourloni Gaubert, 2003

Common name: Bourlon's genet.
Synonyms: none.
Distribution: Ghana, Guinea, Ivory Coast, Liberia, Sierra Leone.
Habitat: rain forest.
Sympatric species: G. johnstoni, G. pardina, G. poensis, P. leightoni.

Representation.Label: Genetta poensis
Representation.Detail:
Genetta poensis Waterhouse, 1838

Common name: king genet.
Synonyms: none.
Distribution: Congo, Equatorial Guinea (Bioko Island), Ghana, Liberia.
Habitat: rain forest.
Sympatric species: G. bourloni, G. johnstoni, G. maculata, G. pardina, G. "schoutedeni", G. servalina, P. leightoni, P. richardsonii.

Representation.Label: Genetta maculata
Representation.Detail:
Genetta maculata (Gray, 1830)

Common name: rusty-spotted genet.
Synonyms: aequatorialis Heuglin, 1866; albiventris Roberts, 1932; deorum Funaioli and Simonetta, 1960; erlangeri Matschie, 1902; fieldiana Du Chaillu, 1860; gleimi Matschie, 1902; insularis Cabrera, 1921; matschiei Neumann, 1902; pumila Hollister, 1916; schraderi Matschie, 1902; soror Schwarz, 1929; stuhlmanni Matschie, 1902; zambesiana Matschie, 1902.
Distribution: Angola, Benin, Botswana, Burundi, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Chad, Congo, Democratic Republic of Congo, Equatorial Guinea (Basilio, 1962), Eritrea, Ethiopia, Gabon, Ghana, Kenya, Malawi, Mozambique, Namibia, Nigeria, Rwanda, Somalia, Sudan, Tanzania, Togo, Uganda, Zambia.
Habitat: rain forest, woodland savannah, savannah-forest mosaic, montane forest.
Sympatric species: G. abyssinica, G. angolensis, G. cristata, G. genetta, G. poensis, G. "schoutedeni", G. servalina, G. thierryi, G. victoriae, P. richardsonii .

* Similar with G. letabae, but (1) narrower inter-orbital constriction relative to frontal width, and (2) larger zygomatic arch (characterized through morphometric geometric analysis; Gaubert et al., 2005).

Representation.Label: Genetta "letabae"
Representation.Detail:
Genetta letabae Thomas and Schwann, 1906 [provisional species name]

Synonyms: zuluensis Roberts, 1924.
Distribution: Lesotho, Mozambique, Namibia, South Africa, Swaziland.
Habitat: woodland savannah, savannah-forest mosaic.
Sympatric species: G. genetta, G. "schoutedeni", G. tigrina (G. angolensis: uncertain).

* Similar with G. maculata, but (1) wider inter-orbital constriction relative to frontal width, and (2) narrower zygomatic arch (characterized through morphometric geometric analysis; Gaubert et al., 2005).

Representation.Label: Genetta "schoutedeni"
Representation.Detail:
Genetta schoutedeni (Crawford-Cabral, 1970) [provisional species name]

Common name: Schouteden's genet.
Synonyms: [provisionally]suahelica Matschie, 1902.
Distribution: Angola, Burundi, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Congo, Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Ghana, Kenya, Mozambique, Nigeria, Rwanda, Sudan, Tanzania, Togo, Uganda.
Habitat: rain forest, woodland savannah, savannah-forest mosaic, montane forest.
Sympatric species: G. abyssinica, G. angolensis, G. genetta, G. "letabae", G. maculata, G. poensis, G. servalina, G. victoriae, P. richardsonii.

Representation.Label: Genetta tigrina
Representation.Detail:
Genetta tigrina (Schreber, 1776)

Common name: Cape genet.
Synonyms: methi Roberts, 1948.
Distribution: South Africa.
Habitat: fynbos, grassland, coastal forest.
Sympatric species: G. felina, G. "letabae" (narrow hybrid zone in KwaZulu-Natal).

Representation.Label: Shape of crest of insertion of temporal muscles (upper part of the parietal)
Posterior extension of the frontal bones, from post-orbital process to post-orbital constriction
large, almost completely overlapping the dorsal part of the interorbital constriction
moderated, overlapping ca. 50 % of the dorsal part of the interorbital constriction
Interorbital constriction
Representation.Detail: The interorbital constriction corresponds to the ratio between the post-orbital constriction and the "frontal constriction" (just anterior to the postorbital process, vertical to the lacrymal foramen). The value 0.12 is the mean of the standard deviation for the means concerning the measures of the interorbital constriction from all the taxa.

Representation.Label: Ventral inflation of the caudal entotympanic bone (ceb)
weak (similar level of inflation with ectotympanic bone)
strong (twice as much inflated than ectotympanic bone)
very strong (thrice as much inflated than ectotympanic bone)
Premaxillary-maxillary suture position in relation to cusp of P1
Maxillary-palatine suture position in relation to main cusp of P3
weak (teeth thinner, with less trenchant cusps)
developed (similar to size of m1 talonid)
Flattening of the anterior region of the mandible
reduced (only hypoconulid present; entoconid and hypoconid absent)
Cross section shape of dorsal guard hair (base of spatula)
Margin of the scales located in the middle of the spatula of dorsal guard hair
Shape of the scales located between the base and the middle of dorsal guard hair
Pair of wide median nuchal stripes
same as ground coloration but dark around pads
same as ground coloration but dark posterior part
same as ground coloration but dark around pads
same as ground coloration but dark posterior part
absent (similar length than adjacent dorsal hairs)
inferior chops bordered by a large dark stripe
inferior chops bordered by a thin dark stripe
Sagital (nuchal) crest
Representation.Detail: The sagital crest is defined as a thin stripe of nuchal hairs orientated the opposite way to the adjacent nuchal hairs.

Representation.Label: Number of bright rings on tail (not included, if present: i) short, distal bright ring, and ii) last bright ring covered with dark)
Relative width of the bright rings over the dark rings (middle of tail, dorsal view)
Shape of the first dark rings of the tail
alternation of dark and bright rings
the last bright ring is covered with dark
several bright terminal rings are covered with dark
"Dirty"stripe longitudinally crossing the rings of the upper part of the tail
Longitudinal coalescence of the first row of dorsal spots (contiguous to mid-dorsal line)
important, at the rump (fusion of> 3 spots)
complete, forming a continuous stripe on the whole back
Density of distribution of dorsal spots
not a continuous stripe (one row of median spots)
longitudinally crossed by a brighter (ground coloration) line

Representation.Label: Shape of crest of insertion of temporal muscles (upper part of the parietal) - m77
Shape of crest of insertion of temporal muscles (upper part of the parietal) - m78
Shape of crest of insertion of temporal muscles (upper part of the parietal) - m79
very narrow stripe, not elevated - m82
large, almost completely overlapping the dorsal part of the interorbital constriction - m85
weak (similar level of inflation with ectotympanic bone) - m92
strong (twice as much inflated than ectotympanic bone) - m93
very strong (thrice as much inflated than ectotympanic bone) - m94
weak (teeth thinner, with less trenchant cusps) - m98
weak (teeth thinner, with less trenchant cusps) - m99
reduced (< size of m1 talonid) - m102
developed (similar to size of m1 talonid) - m103
reduced (only hypoconulid present; entoconid and hypoconid absent) - m109
developed (hypoconulid, entoconid and hypoconid present) - m110
same as ground coloration but dark posterior part - m128
merged into fragmented horizontal lines - m131
same as ground coloration but dark posterior part - m134

present (longer than adjacent dorsal hairs) - m137

inferior chops bordered by a thin dark stripe - m141
alternation of dark and bright rings - m150
the last bright ring is covered with dark - m151
several bright terminal rings are covered with dark - m152

important, at the rump (fusion of> 3 spots) - m157
